text:list-item.text:p: the presentation deck had fewer slides
this one has many more slides
no need to boot a computer
often fits in a small pocket
very useful when waiting in line
fully accepted in any situation, by anybody
try lock picking in airports waiting lines ;)

text:p.text:span: the lesser known challenge for hackers

draw:text-box.text:p: is it a talk about Rubik's cube?

text:list-item.text:p: you can read/watch it with no more worries
it might get you addiced, you've been warned

text:p.text:span: AN ADDICTIVE PRESENTATION IS APPROACHING FAST!

text:list-item.text:p: sometimes trivial, sometimes the whole challenge
not always obvious, yet very important
beautiful to stay on your desk?
innocent to look like a standard object?
curious as in 'I can't imagine what's going on'
fits in a pocket? on a table in your living room?
sometimes it's just worth its price
sometimes it's impossible to tell in advance
sometimes it moves differently depending on the step
ever got lost in a foreign country?
just make sure you can go back every step

draw:text-box.text:p: where do you think you're going?

text:list-item.text:p: did you really solve the right way?
a teacher who wanted to make pupils 'think'
the rope is barely moving in the neck
some pieces create a real 45 pistol
'trick chest of drawer' (からくり箪笥)
→ many quality of manufacturing, many prices
first time = can't participate in the competition
10 eur + not too weak + fits in the pocket.
no online shop / no physical shop :(

text:list-header.text:p: → unsolved for years → 'this is not for me'

text:list-item.text:p: too easy to: do something, undo it immediately.

draw:text-box.text:p: don't say:“I'm not good for this”

text:list-item.text:p: some people are good with one kind, not with another. it's impredictable.
bring confidence with an easier one

draw:text-box.text:p: most people slide first. a few people rotate first. different difficulty.

text:list-item.text:p: might solve but not give you the real solution

draw:text-box.text:p: (not an expert, just like an RPG gamemaster)

text:list-item.text:p: don't let people play with unsolved puzzles
will just make people hate you
don't show pictures if it gives too many hints
don't just record yourself while solving
ex: looked in Berlin, found nothing
ratings are hard to rely on.
most of them are hard to carry with you
a cut pattern on an unrelated picture
and when there is no detail, it's just boring
